Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: I'm curious how Komodo could reach 1 million tx/sec without compromising security & centralization, @jl777c  could you explain a little bit ?  If Komodo could be that scalable, then with the upcoming smart contract support + the security of Bitcoin network, Komodo would become the best platform out there

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: delayed proof of work

Author: PHBA2061#2530
Content: @polycryptoblog  can you elaborate  ? as  I understand  with dPoW  Komodo is able to "save its history" on other blockchain such as bitcoin blockchain, but how does it help Komodo reaching 1 million tx/sec ?

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: @PHBA2061 the 1 mil tx/s are due to Merkle-on-Merkle, SPV validations and a Burn protocol. Thousands of coins being able to swap against each other thanks to a Burn protocol, maintaining their total emission. And they trust each other because they are being notarized on KMD blockchain (and indirectly onto BTC blockchain).

Author: Alright#0419
Content: It's my understanding that storing the MoMoM in the KMD chain allows a user to verify a tx on any of the parallel chains by looking at the KMD chain. Is that correct?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: MoMoM being merkle root of merkle root of merkle root for anyone wondering

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @PHBA2061  the DPoW provides the security if the application accepting the KMD/assetchain waits for a notarization.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @Alright   yes, merkle root is included in block header of parallel chain,  this allows parallel chain to verify tx was good on its own chain,  since the MoMoM is a cascade effect of merkle roots   one couldnt change original merkle root without changing the rest, so you are correct.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: you can view the momom in the kmd chain to verify tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LvZugPNy6YiT3xCmItUL-h7IJkrL9uzcmfA4XLpkxFE/edit#heading=h.ml4wfpjtfvxx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe that can help answer some questions.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD chain will be required to be able to generate the proofs for the tx, but any tx on any chain can be validated. it is quite powerful

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with each notarization the assetchain sends in the MoM for the blocks since the prior notarization, KMD then calculates the MoMoM for all MoM from all assetchains to add to that notarization. It gets notarized, KMD updates the set of indexes so that now any tx covered by the MoM is able to be proven via nested SPV proofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: building on that is a burn protocol that allows to preserve total coins across  all the chains in a cluster by only allowing to recreate coins that were burnt, onetime on one chain

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Once the kmd scaling goes live, how will this affect daily tx number on the kmd ‚Äòmain chain‚Äô? Will this also significantly increase these numbers? We recently saw the switch with regards to the claiming of rewards to montly instead of yearly, to increase usage security and anonimity. Can we expect a similar effect from the scaling efforts? Or even bigger?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: regardless of the tx, each new chain will add its notarizations to KMD. So a one price of 300KMD to pay the notarization txfees and you can have 1 tx per day or a million on one chain. Of course if there are a million such chains, that is millions of notarizations per day, which would use up most of the chain. And 300 million KMD per year of KMD fees... It seems before then we need to deploy the solution for allowing billions of chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all possible, just no need to solve years ahead of time

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: I was more thinking in the sense that short term it will increase the useage of the main kmd chain

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Which is a good thing and the same reason why kmd switched from yearly to monthly reward claiming

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: But as you say, I dont think it will become an issue or problem that the main kmd chain would be to bloated or whatever

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Short term more of an advantage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: short term advantage. long term even bigger advantage, especially to those who hodl KMD through the bear market

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: @chinmaydshah notary centralisation is touched on in the whitepaper.  for the hypothetical case that notaries became centralised, the worst they could do is not notarise to btc.  for this to happen, more than 50 out of the 64 notary nodes need to conspire with each other to have that effect.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
the voting process is open to all kmd holders.  notary elections are open to anyone.  approximately 30 of the 60 available (out of 64) notary nodes are elected each year.  the other 30 are automatically elected.
what decides auto-re-election?  the top performing notary nodes (the ones that participate in the multisig transaction to btc, "the notarisation"), so it is in the notaries interest to perform their function to be auto-re-elected, otherwise, they must stand for election with freshly enthusiastic candidates.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
30+30 != 64.  what about the other 4?
There are 4 notary nodes that are used by dev team afaik

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Also the Komodo notary election process is costless to the voter. They get airdropped VOTE tokens equivalent to the amount of KMD they hold. So voters don't need to  actually spend real money to make their opinion heard.
